intro: Leptosiphon ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers with five petals. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Leptosiphon ambiguus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
